net.netnook.repeg

Class ParserFactoryBase<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.netnook.repeg.ParserFactoryBase<T>

  • public abstract class ParserFactoryBase<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for defining parsers.

      • getStartRule

        protected abstract RuleEnum getStartRule()
        This method should return the start rule for parsing the input.
        Returns:
        start rule.

      • sequence

        protected static Sequence.Builder sequence(ExpressionBuilder... expressions)
        Create a new Sequence expression with the specified sub-expressions.

        A Sequence matches if all it's sub-expressions match in the specified order.

        Parameters:
        expressions - sub-expressions to match in sequence
        Returns:
        the new Sequence expression.

      • choice

        protected static Choice.Builder choice(ExpressionBuilder... expressions)
        Create a new Choice expression for the specified sub-expressions.

        Each sub-expression is tested in turn and a Choice matches if one of these sub-expressions match.

        Parameters:
        expressions - the sub-expressions to match in order.
        Returns:
        the new Choice expression.

      • one

        protected static Repetition.Builder one(char c)
        Match a single character in the input.

        Creates a new Repetition expression with min and max count of 1 containing as a sub-expression a CharMatcher for the single character c.

        Parameters:
        c - character to match
        Returns:
        the new Repetition expression.

      • one

        protected static Repetition.Builder one(CharMatcher charMatcher)
        Match a single character in the input.

        Creates a new Repetition expression with min and max count of 1 containing as a sub-expression the specified CharMatcher.

        Parameters:
        charMatcher - character matcher to perform match.
        Returns:
        the new Repetition expression.

      • zeroOrMore

        protected static Repetition.Builder zeroOrMore(char c)
        Match a zero or more characters in the input.

        Creates a new Repetition expression with min count 0 and max count Integer.MAX_VALUE containing as a sub-expression a CharMatcher for the single character c.

        Parameters:
        c - character to match
        Returns:
        the new Repetition expression.

      • endOfInput

        protected static EndOfInput endOfInput()
        Match the end of input.

        The resulting matcher will only match when the end of the input has been reached.

        Returns:
        the new EndOfInput expression.

      • endOfLineOrInput

        protected static ExpressionBuilder endOfLineOrInput()
        Match the end of input or new line.

        Equivalent to choice of newLine() or endOfInput().

        Returns:
        the new expression.

      • newLine

        protected static NewlineExpression.Builder newLine()
        Match the end of line sequence. See NewlineExpression.
        Returns:
        the new expression.

                                              char to)
        Create CharMatcher which matches any of the characters in the specified range (inclusive).

        Create CharMatcher which matches any horizontal whitespace. See CharMatchers.horizontalWhitespace().
        Returns:
        the new character matcher.

      • parseFloat

        protected static FloatExpression parseFloat()
        Create an expression which matches a float in the input (e.g. "1.23"). The expression returned contains an OnSuccessHandler which converts the matched input to a Float and adds it to the stack.

        See FloatExpression

        Returns:
        the new float expression.

      • push

        public static OnSuccessHandler push(java.lang.Object value)
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which pushes the specified value onto the stack.
        Parameters:
        value - value to push onto the stack.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushIfEmpty

        public static OnSuccessHandler pushIfEmpty(java.lang.Object defaultValue)
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which pushes the specified value onto the stack if nothing was added to the stack by the expression or any descendants.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - to push onto the stack.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushText

        public static OnSuccessHandler pushText()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which pushes the matched input text onto the stack as a CharSequence.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushTextAsString

        protected static OnSuccessHandler pushTextAsString()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which pushes the matched input text onto the stack as a String. Will push an empty string if match was of length 0.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushTextAsNullableString

        protected static OnSuccessHandler pushTextAsNullableString()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which pushes the matched input text onto the stack as a String. Will push null if match was of length 0.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushTextAsInteger

        protected static OnSuccessHandler pushTextAsInteger()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which converts the matches input to a Integer and pushes it onto the stack.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushTextAsFloat

        protected static OnSuccessHandler pushTextAsFloat()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which converts the matches input to a Float and pushes it onto the stack.
        Returns:
        the new handler.

      • pushTextAsNullableFloat

        protected static OnSuccessHandler pushTextAsNullableFloat()
        Create an OnSuccessHandler which converts the matches input to a Float and pushes it onto the stack, pushing null if the match was of length 0.
        Returns:
        the new handler.
